detaileddescription.para: This item needs to be updated whenever the log entry structure changes!!

memberdef.definition: typedef Retcode_T(* ErrorLogger_EraseFunc_T)(ErrorLogger_StorageMedium_T storageSelect, void *value, uint32_t StartAddr, uint32_t numOfBytes)
memberdef.argsstring: )(ErrorLogger_StorageMedium_T storageSelect, void *value, uint32_t StartAddr, uint32_t numOfBytes)
memberdef.name: ErrorLogger_EraseFunc_T

briefdescription.para: This function writes the data from the specified partition of the storage medium.

simplesect.para: Before calling this function ensure ErrorLogger_Init has been done. Also the caller of this function has to ensure the valid position & no of bytes to erase from the medium.

parameterdescription.para: : Type of the storage medium to erase.
pointer to destination value to hold the data. This pointer should have enough room to place no of bytes that is mentioned in argument numOfBytes.
offset from the start of the partition.
Number of bytes to erase from the storage medium.
when the erase was successful else an error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: This function is used to provide the time stamp and unit will be based on application perspective.

memberdef.definition: typedef Retcode_T(* ErrorLogger_ReadFunc_T)(ErrorLogger_StorageMedium_T storageSelect, void *value, uint32_t StartAddr, uint32_t numOfBytes)
memberdef.argsstring: )(ErrorLogger_StorageMedium_T storageSelect, void *value, uint32_t StartAddr, uint32_t numOfBytes)
memberdef.name: ErrorLogger_ReadFunc_T

briefdescription.para: This function reads the data from the specified partition of the storage medium.

simplesect.para: Before calling this function ensure ErrorLogger_Init has been done. Also the caller of this function has to ensure the valid position & no of bytes to read from the medium.

parameterdescription.para: Type of the storage medium to read.
pointer to destination value to hold the data. This pointer should have enough room to place no of bytes that is mentioned in argument numOfBytes.
offset from the start of the partition.
Number of bytes to read from the storage medium.
if the read was successful, else an error code is returned.

memberdef.definition: typedef Retcode_T(* ErrorLogger_WriteFunc_T)(ErrorLogger_StorageMedium_T storageSelect, void *value, uint32_t StartAddr, uint32_t numOfBytes)
memberdef.argsstring: )(ErrorLogger_StorageMedium_T storageSelect, void *value, uint32_t StartAddr, uint32_t numOfBytes)
memberdef.name: ErrorLogger_WriteFunc_T

briefdescription.para: This function writes the data from the specified partition of the storage medium.

simplesect.para: Before calling this function ensure ErrorLogger_Init has been done. Also the caller of this function has to ensure the valid position & no of bytes to write from the medium.

parameterdescription.para: Type of the storage medium to write.
pointer to destination value to hold the data. This pointer should have enough room to place no of bytes that is mentioned in argument numOfBytes.
offset from the start of the partition.
Number of bytes to write from the storage medium.
if the write was successful, else an error code is returned.

detaileddescription.para: It records the timestamp (uptime) of error occurance
It holds the Retcode_T which says from where the error comes
The serial port LINE CODING data structure, used to carry information about serial port baudrate, parity etc. between host and device.

briefdescription.para: API to clear all the error in the user page.

parameterdescription.para: when all the errors have been erased successfully and the error logger is reinitialized successfully

simplesect.para: errors from either the erase operation (see ErrorLoggerConfig_T.EraseLogs) or the error logger initialization (see ErrorLogger_Init)

briefdescription.para: API to query numbers of errors available in the storage medium.

simplesect.para: numbers of errors in the storage medium.

briefdescription.para: API to get the error at particular index.

parameterdescription.para: - Index of the error to be queried
- If there is an error at this index, it will be filled with that error.
when there is an error at this index and it is successfully read
when the index is bigger than number of error that can be stored
when there is no error at this index

briefdescription.para: API to get the most recent error happened in the system.

detaileddescription.para: Using this API, one can get the most recent error in the system.

simplesect.para: if there is an error, LogEntry is filled with most recent error, else it is left untouched

parameterdescription.para: - pointer to be filled with last logged error
when the last error is read successfully
when the LogEntry pointer is NULL
when no error was logged yet

briefdescription.para: API to query total number of errors occurred in the system.

simplesect.para: The total number of errors logged can be bigger than the maximum number of entries as the errors are logged in a cyclical manner
numbers of errors in the system.

briefdescription.para: API to query if particular error has happened in the system.

parameterdescription.para: - The Error code to be searched in the logs
when the queried error is present
when the queried error is not present

briefdescription.para: API for initialize the ErrorLogger module.

detaileddescription.para: The current configuration of error logger is that it can store up to 120 bytes where one error log entry is 12 bytes. Thus 10 logs could be stored. This can be modified based on the application requirements.

parameterdescription.para: - data structure handling the information required for error logging
when the ErrorLogger module is successfully initialized
when the read operation of the storage agent failed

briefdescription.para: API for logging error to the storage medium.

detaileddescription.para: This API is not thread-safe and the priority has to be handled in the application.
It logs the errors to the storage medium along with timestamp. It also counts and numbers all the errors.

parameterdescription.para: - Error code to be logged.
when error is logged successfully
when trying to log a RETCODE_OK value for error (which is not an error...)

simplesect.para: when writing failed, the actual error code is the one returned by the #WriteLogs function (see ErrorLoggerConfig_T)
